definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
to extend New Year's greetings/to pay a New Year's visit
money given to children as new year present
Long live (the king, the revolution etc)!/Your Majesty/His Majesty
one full year (e.g. on child's first birthday)
Tai Sui, God of the year/archaic name for the planet Jupiter 木星[Mu4 xing1]/nickname for sb who is the most powerful in an area
to see in the New Year/to stay up all night on lunar New Year's Eve

one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]

sentences.chinese: 左外锋，17岁就为曼联初次登场。

sentences.english: Zhao Min is a Chinese girl.
sentences.chinese: 赵敏是一个中国女孩，她今年13岁。

sentences.english: More than 2,000 women aged 18-34 were  interviewed for the poll.
sentences.chinese: 共有两千多名18岁至34岁的女性参与了该项调查。

sentences.english: More than 2,000 women aged 18-34 were  interviewed for the poll.
sentences.chinese: 共有两千多名18岁至34岁的女性参与了该项调查。

sentences.english: My 6-year old brother and I became her constant bodyguards.
sentences.chinese: 我和6岁的弟弟成了她的贴身保镖。

sentences.english: Early today, the body of a 25-year-old man was found in West Town.
sentences.chinese: 今天一早，在西城发现一具25岁男子的尸体。

sentences.english: Over the next few years, the couple worked, raised their children—Isabel andEli, who were seven and ten years old when their grandfather moved in—and cared for Winokur’s father.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们的祖父搬来时他们分别有7岁和10岁。

sentences.english: Over the next few years, the couple worked, raised their children—Isabel andEli, who were seven and ten years old when their grandfather moved in—and cared for Winokur’s father.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们的祖父搬来时他们分别有7岁和10岁。

sentences.english: Children under 18 are not admitted to this film.
sentences.chinese: 未满18岁的小孩不得入场看这部电影。

sentences.english: The missing sailors are two men aged 30 and 52.
sentences.chinese: 失踪的两名船员为30岁和52岁男子。

sentences.english: The missing sailors are two men aged 30 and 52.
sentences.chinese: 失踪的两名船员为30岁和52岁男子。

sentences.english: Another 9-year old girl died after being admitted to hospital.
sentences.chinese: 另外一名年仅9岁的小女孩在被送入医院后不治。

sentences.english: I found myself, at 81, an instant billionaire.
sentences.chinese: 我发现我自己以一位81岁的亿万富翁。

sentences.english: Today would have been Senator Kennedy’s 79th birthday.
sentences.chinese: 今天是肯尼迪议员先生的79岁诞辰。

definition: one full year (e.g. on child's first birthday)
how old are you? (familiar, or to a child)

one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
peer/one's contemporary/person of the same age
method of calculating a person's age in years from birth/see also 虛歲|虚岁[xu1 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
to be in the prime of life
